address: Xã Hoằng Phong, Huyện Hoằng Hóa, Tỉnh Thanh Hóa
thought:
**My Analysis of the Administrative Unit Change**

Okay, so I'm presented with the old address "Xã Hoằng Phong, Huyện Hoằng Hóa, Tỉnh Thanh Hóa" and need to find its new administrative unit. First, I extracted the key components: the old ward "Xã Hoằng Phong" and the province "Tỉnh Thanh Hóa".

Knowing my workflow, I immediately went to check if Thanh Hóa province had been subject to any mergers or changes according to the relevant province resolutions, specifically 60-NQ/TW. Fortunately, it's listed as "không thực hiện sáp nhập," meaning the province name remains "Tỉnh Thanh Hóa."

Next, I delved into the "Other resolutions" to see if there were any ward-level changes involving "Xã Hoằng Phong." Resolution 1686/NQ-UBTVQH15, concerning Thanh Hóa's ward reorganization, seemed promising. I scanned it thoroughly.

Line 23 of that resolution was the gold mine! It explicitly states that "Xã Hoằng Phong," along with other wards, is merged to form the new ward "Xã Hoằng Châu." Bingo!

With the new ward identified, I cross-referenced this with the "New wards" data to find the ward code and confirm the province name. The data perfectly matched: `{"ward_code":"15976","ward_name":"Xã Hoằng Châu","province_name":"Tỉnh Thanh Hóa"}`.  That's a very solid confirmation.

The resolution explicitly states the merge.  The district is not relevant, as per the general rule of eliminating all districts.  My confidence in this result is very high. Therefore, the old ward "Xã Hoằng Phong" now belongs to the ward "Xã Hoằng Châu" with a ward code of "15976", and the province is still "Tỉnh Thanh Hóa".

citation.header: 1686/NQ-UBTVQH15: Sắp xếp các đơn vị hành chính cấp xã của tỉnh Thanh Hóa
citation.line: 23. Sắp xếp toàn bộ diện tích tự nhiên, quy mô dân số của các xã Hoằng Thắng, Hoằng Phong, Hoằng Lưu và Hoằng Châu thành xã mới có tên gọi là xã Hoằng Châu.
